<DESCRIPTION>EXECUTIVE SEPARATION PAY PLAN
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Executive Separation Pay Plan</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Exhibit 10.13 </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>BARNES GROUP INC. EXECUTIVE SEPARATION PAY PLAN </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>As Amended and Restated Effective
December&nbsp;31, 2008 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Preamble </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">The Barnes Group Inc. Executive Separation Pay Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;) was amended in December 2007 and was further amended and restated effective December&nbsp;31, 2008 to respond to Section&nbsp;409A of the Internal Revenue Code of
1986, as amended (the &#147;Code&#148;) and the Treasury Regulations and official guidance thereunder. Any provision of the Plan as so amended and restated to the contrary notwithstanding, if any provision of the Plan as so amended and restated
would change the time or form of payment of any amount that is payable under the Plan as in effect before December&nbsp;31, 2008, such provision shall &#147;apply only to amounts that would not otherwise be payable in 2008&#148; within the meaning
of paragraph .02 of &#167;3 of IRS Notice 2006-79 as modified by Section&nbsp;3.01(B)(1) of IRS Notice 2007-86, and shall be administered, interpreted and construed accordingly. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1. <B><U>Purpose</U></B>. The purpose of the Plan is to provide appropriate benefits to eligible executives of Barnes Group Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) whose employment is terminated by the Company. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2. <B><U>Covered Employees</U></B>. Full-time salaried employees of the Company who are employed in the United States in salary grades 24 and above, and full-time
salaried employees of the Company who are employed in the United States in salary grades 18 through 23 who have at least six months of service, are covered by the Plan. A person is considered to be a full-time employee if the person is regularly
scheduled to work at least 30 hours per week. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3. <B><U>Payment of Benefits</U></B>. An employee covered under the Plan is entitled to receive benefits under the Plan
if s/he has an &#147;involuntary Separation from Service&#148; within the meaning of Treasury Regulation section 1.409A-1(n)(1) and such involuntary Separation from Service is without Cause; provided, however, that no benefits will be paid under the
Plan if: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the termination action is determined by the Company to be based on misconduct of any type including, but not limited to, violation of any Company rules or policies, or activity
which results in the conviction of a felony; or </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the termination is the result of the sale of the stock or substantially all of the assets of a business unit of the Company and the employee is offered employment by the purchaser,
within 30 days after the closing of the sale, in a position that is at least comparable to, and for compensation and benefits that are, in the aggregate, at least substantially equivalent to, the employee&#146;s position, compensation and benefits
with the Company prior to the sale; or </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the employee is a party on December&nbsp;31, 2008 to a severance agreement with the Company relating to Separation from Service after a &#147;Change in
Control&#148; of the Company as defined in the agreement (a &#147;Severance Agreement&#148;), or is an executive officer of the Company hired after that date, and the Separation from Service is both (i)&nbsp;a Separation from Service within two
</FONT>
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P>
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">years following a &#147;Change in Control&#148;, and (ii)&nbsp;either an involuntary Separation from Service (within the meaning of Treasury Regulation
section 1.409A-1(n)(1)) by the Company other than for &#147;Cause&#148; or &#147;Disability&#148;, or a Separation from Service by the employee for &#147;Good Reason&#148;, as such terms in quotation marks are defined in the form of Severance
Agreement as amended December&nbsp;31, 2008. For the avoidance of doubt, the exclusion set forth in this clause (c)&nbsp;shall apply even if the Change in Control referred to in subclause (i)&nbsp;hereof does not occur during the term of the
Severance Agreement, and even if no severance benefits are payable pursuant to the Severance Agreement in respect of the Separation from Service and, in the case of an executive officer hired after December&nbsp;31, 2008, even if the employee is not
party to a Severance Agreement. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For purposes of this Plan, (A)&nbsp;a &#147;Separation from Service&#148; means a &#147;separation from
service with the employer&#148; within the meaning of Treasury Regulation section 1.409A-1(h), where the &#147;employer&#148; means the Company and all corporations and trades or businesses with which the Company would be considered a single
employer under Section&nbsp;414(b) or Section&nbsp;414(c) of the Code (as determined in accordance with the first sentence of Treasury Regulation section 1.409A-1(h)(3)); and (B)&nbsp;&#147;Cause&#148; means misconduct or activity described in
(a)&nbsp;above, serious dereliction of duty, or grossly negligent or reckless conduct in connection with one&#146;s employment. An employee who is entitled to receive benefits under the Plan in accordance with Section&nbsp;2 and the foregoing
provisions of this Section&nbsp;3 is hereinafter sometimes referred to as a &#147;terminated employee&#148;. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4. <U><B>Severance Pay</B></U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.1</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A terminated employee who is entitled to receive benefits under this Plan is eligible to receive severance pay based on the following schedule: </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Grades 18-20: four months of base salary plus an additional two weeks of base salary for each year of service over five years up to a maximum total payment of six months of base
salary. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Grades 21-23: seven months of base salary. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Grades 24 and above, except for the President and Chief Executive Officer: twelve months of base salary. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The minimum severance pay benefit payable under this Plan shall be one month&#146;s base salary or the amount of accrued vacation, whichever is greater,
and shall be paid within thirty days after the terminated employee&#146;s Separation from Service. For purposes of the Plan, &#147;base salary&#148; means the employee&#146;s base salary in effect immediately prior to the employee&#146;s Separation
from Service, and any severance payment shall be calculated on the basis of the employee&#146;s salary grade immediately prior to the employee&#146;s Separation from Service. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.2</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Subject to the other provisions of this Section&nbsp;4 and Section&nbsp;8.5 below, payment shall be made on the terminated employee&#146;s regularly scheduled
payroll payment dates as if no Separation from Service had occurred and he/she had continued as an employee, commencing with the next regularly scheduled payroll payment date after the date on which the terminated employee&#146;s Separation from
Service occurs, and continuing on each regularly scheduled payroll payment date thereafter until full payment has been made in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.1 above, and will be </FONT>
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P>
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">subject to normal deductions for items such as income taxes, Social Security, and Medicare. For the avoidance of doubt, (a)&nbsp;&#147;regularly scheduled
payroll payment dates&#148; means the payroll payment dates per the payroll schedule applicable to the terminated employee immediately prior to the employee&#146;s Separation from Service, and (b)&nbsp;subject to the other provisions of this
Section&nbsp;4 and Section&nbsp;8.5 below, the amount payable on each such regularly scheduled payment date is the amount of base salary that would have been paid to the terminated employee on that date if no Separation from Service had occurred and
the terminated employee had been an employee of the Company on that date, but in no event shall the aggregate payments exceed the severance pay benefit determined in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.1 above, nor shall payments be made more than twelve
calendar months after the calendar month in which an employee&#146;s Separation from Service occurs. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.3</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In no event will more than the minimum severance pay benefit (including but not limited to benefits payable pursuant to Section&nbsp;6 below) be paid or provided
unless the terminated employee executes after Separation from Service a release of any claims against the Company in a form approved by the Company&#146;s General Counsel, the executed release is delivered to the Company within 50 days after the
Separation from Service or within such lesser period after the Separation from Service as the Company&#146;s General Counsel may require, and the release becomes irrevocable within 60 days after the Separation from Service or within such lesser
period after the Separation from Service as the Company&#146;s General Counsel may require. Any severance pay benefits in excess of the minimum severance pay benefit (including but not limited to benefits payable pursuant to Section&nbsp;6 below)
</FONT>
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P>
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">that, in the absence of this Section&nbsp;4.3, would be paid or provided pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.2 above or Section&nbsp;6 below before the release
becomes irrevocable shall be paid or provided after the release becomes irrevocable and within 74 days after the Separation from Service. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.4</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company may at any time provide in advance of any date after the employee&#146;s Separation from Service occurs that any severance pay benefit payable to the terminated employee
pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.2 above or Section&nbsp;6 below on or after that date will be forfeited unless on or before that date, (a)&nbsp;the terminated employee executes a second release of claims against the Company and delivers such second
release to the Company, and (b)&nbsp;such second release of claims becomes irrevocable. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.5</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Severance pay for a terminated employee who was in any of salary grades 18 through 26 shall cease on the date that such terminated employee begins other employment, including but
not limited to work for another party. The terminated employee shall promptly notify the Company in writing when he/she commences such employment. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.6</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Severance pay for a terminated employee who was in any of salary grades 27 and above shall not cease on the date that such terminated employee begins other employment, including but
not limited to work for another party, but shall continue throughout the entire severance period. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5. <B><U>Accrued Vacation</U></B>. A
terminated employee who executes a release of claims in a form approved by the Company&#146;s General Counsel shall be paid for any unused vacation or paid time off that he/she has accrued in accordance with Company </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">policy prior to the Separation from Service. Payment for such accrued unused vacation or paid time off shall be made in a lump sum, net of normal deductions
for items such as income taxes, Social Security and Medicare, within thirty days after the employee&#146;s Separation from Service. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6. <B><U>Other
Benefits</U></B>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.1</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A person may continue participation, on the same terms in effect immediately prior to termination, in the Company&#146;s medical, dental, group life, supplemental
life, dependent life, accidental death and dismemberment insurance, flexible benefit (i.e., premium pass-through plan, health care reimbursement account and dependent care reimbursement account), and long term disability plans for the period during
which he/she receives severance payments. If payments cease during but prior to the end of any month, coverage will continue until the end of the last month during which such terminated employee receives any severance payments. Subject to
Section&nbsp;4.3 and Section&nbsp;4.4 above and to Section&nbsp;8.5 below<B>, </B>if immediately prior to the Separation from Service the terminated employee was a participant in the Company&#146;s Enhanced Life Insurance Program (&#147;ELIP&#148;)
or Senior Executive Enhanced Life Insurance Program (&#147;SEELIP&#148;) who had not yet attained age fifty-five (55)&nbsp;and at least ten (10)&nbsp;years of service with the Company and/or an &#147;Affiliate&#148; (as defined in the ELIP and
SEELIP), then until the end of the calendar quarter in which the last severance payment is made to the terminated employee pursuant to Section&nbsp;4 hereof, such terminated employee shall receive the same benefits, if any, under the ELIP or SEELIP
as in effect immediately prior to Separation from Service (whichever program, if any, applied to the terminated employee immediately prior to such employee&#146;s Separation from Service), at the same times, that the terminated employee would have
received if the ELIP and SEELIP as in effect immediately prior to </FONT>
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P>
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Separation from Service had remained in effect and no Separation from Service had occurred and the terminated employee had continued to be actively employed
and to receive his or her base salary until the last day of the calendar quarter in which the last severance payment is made to such terminated employee pursuant to Section&nbsp;4 above; provided that, notwithstanding anything herein to the
contrary, the Company may reduce the benefits payable pursuant to this sentence at any time, and, provided further, that in no event shall any benefits be paid or provided pursuant to this sentence after the calendar quarter in which the last
severance payment is made to the terminated employee pursuant to Section&nbsp;4 hereof. If prior to the Separation from Service the terminated employee was a participant in the ELIP or SEELIP who had attained age fifty-five (55)&nbsp;and at least
ten (10)&nbsp;years of service with the Company and/or an &#147;Affiliate&#148; (as defined in the ELIP and SEELIP), then after the Separation from Service the terminated employee&#146;s entitlement to any benefits under the ELIP or SEELIP shall be
determined in accordance with the ELIP or SEELIP (whichever program, if any, applied to the terminated employee immediately prior to such employee&#146;s Separation from Service). Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, the Company reserves
the right to discontinue or change the terms (including but not limited to the carrier) of any employee benefit plan, including without limitation the ELIP and the SEELIP. After severance payments cease, </FONT>
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P>
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">COBRA medical and dental coverage and the health care reimbursement account may be continued as required by law. Within the meaning of Treasury Regulation
section 1.409A-3(i)(1)(iv), the amount of any expenses eligible for reimbursement, or in-kind benefits provided, pursuant to this Section&nbsp;6.1 or otherwise during a terminated employee&#146;s taxable year may not affect the expenses eligible for
reimbursement, or in-kind benefits to be provided, pursuant to this Section&nbsp;6.1 or otherwise in any other taxable year. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.2</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Except to facilitate benefit continuation as provided in Section&nbsp;6.1 hereof, a person&#146;s status as an employee shall cease upon the termination of employment date and not
continue during the period in which severance payments are made absent an agreement with the Company to the contrary. Without limiting the foregoing, employment shall be terminated for purposes of the Retirement Savings Plan, any applicable pension
or profit-sharing plan, stock option plans, and for all other purposes upon the termination of employment date. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.3</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The right of a terminated employee to any series of installment payments, including without limitation severance payments and taxable benefits, that are to be paid or provided under
this Plan, which right is eligible to be treated as a right to a series of separate payments under Treasury Regulation section 1.409A-2(b)(2)(iii), including in particular but not limited to the right of a terminated employee to the series of
severance payments under Section&nbsp;4 and benefits (including without limitation ELIP and SEELIP benefits) under Section&nbsp;6.1, shall be treated as a right to a series of separate payments for purposes of Section&nbsp;409A of the Code,
including without limitation for purposes of the short-term deferral rule set forth in Treasury Regulation section 1.409A-1(b)(4). </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">9 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7. <B><U>Administration</U></B>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7.1</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Benefits Committee. The Plan is administered by the Benefits Committee appointed by the Company&#146;s Board of Directors (the &#147;Committee&#148;). The Committee may promulgate
rules or regulations for the administration of the Plan. The Committee shall, in its sole discretion, interpret and construe the Plan&#146;s terms and conditions, and determine an individual&#146;s eligibility for benefits. Any interpretations,
constructions or determinations made by the Committee in good faith shall be final and binding on all concerned. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7.2</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Claims Procedure. If any person believes that he/she is not receiving any benefits to which he/she is entitled under the Plan, the person, after reviewing the matter with the human
resource representative serving the person&#146;s place of work, may file a written claim with the Director, Leadership and Development, Barnes Group Inc., 123 Main Street, Bristol, Connecticut 06010, or such other person designated by the Benefits
Committee, who shall respond to such claim in writing within 45 days after its receipt. If any claim is denied, the claimant may appeal such denial in writing to the Benefits Committee, c/o Barnes Group Inc., 123 Main Street, Bristol, Connecticut
06010. Any such appeal must be filed within 60 days after the denial of the claim. The Benefits Committee shall notify the claimant of its decision in writing within 60 days after receiving the appeal. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">10 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8. <B><U>Other Provisions</U></B>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.1</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This Plan may be amended or terminated at any time and in any respect by the vote of a majority of the members of the Benefits Committee or by the unanimous written consent of the
members of the Benefits Committee. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.2</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The benefits to be provided under this Plan shall not be funded and shall be paid out of the general assets of the Company. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.3</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For purposes of determining: </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">an employee&#146;s eligibility under Section&nbsp;2 of the Plan; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the schedule of severance pay payments under Section&nbsp;4 of the Plan; and </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the period of continuation of other benefits described in Section&nbsp;6 of the Plan, </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">only service since the employee&#146;s last date of hire with the Company shall be counted. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.4</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Plan shall be construed, administered and enforced under the laws of the State of Connecticut except to the extent such laws are preempted by federal law.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.5</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Any provision of this Plan to the contrary notwithstanding, (a)&nbsp;no &#147;distributions&#148; (within the meaning of Treasury Regulation section
1.409A-1(c)(3)(v)) of deferred compensation that is subject to Section&nbsp;409A of the Code may be made pursuant to this Plan to a &#147;specified employee&#148; (within the meaning of Treasury Regulation section 1.409A-1(i))(&#147;Specified
Employee&#148;) due to a Separation from Service before the date that is six months after the date of such Specified Employee&#146;s Separation from Service (or, if earlier than the end of the six month period, the date of his or her death); and
(b)&nbsp;any distribution that, but for the preceding clause (a), </FONT>
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">11 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P>
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">would be made before the date that is six months after the date of the Specified Employee&#146;s Separation from Service shall be paid on the first day of
the seventh month following the date of his or her Separation from Service (or, if earlier, within 14 days after the date of his or her death). For the avoidance of doubt, the preceding sentence shall apply to any amount or benefit (and only to any
amount or benefit) to be paid or provided pursuant to this Plan to which Code Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(B)(i) (relating to Specified Employees) applies, and shall not apply to any amount or benefit to be paid or provided pursuant to this Plan if and
to the extent that such amount or benefit is not subject to Section&nbsp;409A of the Code as a result of Treasury Regulation section 1.409A-1(a)(4) (relating to welfare benefits), Treasury Regulation Section&nbsp;1.409A-1(b)(4) (relating to
short-term deferrals), Treasury Regulation Section&nbsp;1.409A-1(b)(9) (relating to separation pay plans), or otherwise. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.6</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If at any time during the 12-month period ending on any &#147;specified employee identification date&#148;, which shall be December&nbsp;31, a person who
participates in or has any legally binding right, contingent or otherwise, under this Plan (a &#147;Plan Participant&#148;), is in Salary Grade 20 or above or meets the requirements of Code section 416(i)(1)(A)(ii) or (iii)&nbsp;(applied in
accordance with the Treasury Regulations thereunder and disregarding Code Section&nbsp;416(i)(5)), then the Plan Participant shall be treated as a Specified Employee for purposes of Section&nbsp;8.5 above for the entire 12-month period beginning on
the &#147;specified employee effective date&#148;, which shall be the January&nbsp;1 that immediately follows such specified employee identification date, unless the Board of Directors of the </FONT>
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">12 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P>
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Company (the &#147;Board of Directors&#148;) or its Compensation and Management Development Committee (the &#147;CMDC&#148;) at any time prescribes a
different method of identifying service providers who will be subject to the six month delay required by Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(B)(i) of the Code (the &#147;Six Month Delay&#148;) in accordance with Treasury Regulation section 1.409A-1(i) or the
transition rules and official guidance under Code Section&nbsp;409A (a &#147;Different Identification Method&#148;) or elects a different specified employee identification date or specified employee effective date or makes any other election that
may be made in accordance with Treasury Regulation section 1.409A-1(i) or the transition rules and official guidance under Code Section&nbsp;409A (a &#147;Different Election&#148;), in which case whether the Plan Participant shall be treated as a
Specified Employee shall be determined in accordance with any such Different Identification Method so prescribed and any such Different Election so made by the Board of Directors or the CMDC. By participating or continuing to participate in this
Plan or accepting any legally binding right or benefit under this Plan, each Plan Participant irrevocably (a)&nbsp;consents to any such Different Identification Method that the Board of Directors or CMDC may prescribe at any time and any such
Different Election that the Board of Directors or CMDC may make at any time for purposes of identifying the service providers who will be subject to the Six Month Delay with respect to payments under this Plan, and (b)&nbsp;agrees that the Plan
Participant&#146;s consent to any such Different Identification Method or Different Election shall be as effective as if such Different Identification Method or Different Election were fully set forth herein, and (c)&nbsp;waives any right he or she
may have to consent to the Different Identification Method or Different Election in question if for any reason the Plan Participant&#146;s consent to such Different Identification Method or Different Election is not legally effective.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">13 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.7</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Any payments that may be made and benefits that may be provided pursuant to this Plan are intended to qualify for an exclusion from Section&nbsp;409A of the Code (including without
limitation the exclusion for certain welfare benefits under Treasury Regulation section 1.409A-1(a)(5), the exclusion for short-term deferrals under Treasury Regulation section 1.409A-1(b)(4), and the exclusions for separation pay plans under
Treasury Regulation section 1.409A-1(b)(9)) and/or are intended to meet the requirements of Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2), (3)&nbsp;and (4)&nbsp;of the Code, so that none of the payments that may be made and benefits that may be provided pursuant to this
Plan will be includible in any Plan Participant&#146;s federal gross income pursuant to Section&nbsp;409A(a)(1)(A) of the Code. This Plan and any agreement or instrument issued under this Plan shall be administered, interpreted and construed to
carry out such intentions, and any provision of this Plan or any such agreement or instrument that cannot be so administered, interpreted and construed shall to that extent be disregarded. However, the Company does not represent, warrant or
guarantee that any payments that may be made and benefits that may be provided pursuant to this Plan will not be includible in any Plan Participant&#146;s federal gross income pursuant to Section&nbsp;409A(a)(1)(A) of the Code, nor does the Company
make any other representation, warranty or guaranty to any Plan Participant as to the tax consequences of this Plan or of participation in this Plan. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">14 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.14
<SEQUENCE>13
<FILENAME>dex1014.htm
<DESCRIPTION>PERFORMANCE LINKED BONUS PLAN FOR SELECTED EXECUTIVE OFFICERS
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Performance Linked Bonus Plan for Selected Executive Officers</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Exhibit 10.14 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>BARNES GROUP INC. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:10px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>PERFORMANCE-LINKED BONUS PLAN </U></B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>For Selected Executive Officers </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">(as amended on October&nbsp;22, 2008, effective with respect to awards for 2008) </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>SECTION 1. PURPOSE </U></B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Performance-Linked Bonus Plan For Selected Executive Officers (the &#147;Plan&#148;) is designed to provide cash incentive compensation opportunities
to key executives that contribute to the success of Barnes Group Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) and its subsidiaries. All employees (a)&nbsp;who are executive officers of the Company, (b)&nbsp;whose incentive compensation for any taxable year(s) of
the Company commencing on or after January&nbsp;1, 2001 the Committee (as hereafter defined) anticipates may not be deductible by the Company in whole or in part but for compliance with section 162(m)(4)(C) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 as
amended (the &#147;Code&#148;), and (c)&nbsp;who are selected to participate in the Plan, including members of the Board of Directors of the Company who are such employees, are eligible to participate in the Plan. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>SECTION 2. ADMINISTRATION </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Plan shall be
administered by the Compensation and Management Development Committee of the Board of Directors of the Company, or its successor (the &#147;Committee&#148;). The Committee shall consist of not less than two directors who are not employees of the
Company or any subsidiary of the Company and shall be comprised solely of directors who are &#147;outside directors&#148; within the meaning of Section&nbsp;162(m)(4)(C)(i) of the Code. The Committee shall have authority, subject to the provisions
of the Plan, to: select employees to participate in the Plan; establish and administer the performance objectives and the Award opportunities applicable to each participant and certify whether the goals have been attained; construe and interpret the
Plan and any agreement or instrument entered into under the Plan; establish, amend, and waive rules and regulations for the Plan&#146;s administration; and make all other determinations which may be necessary or advisable for the administration of
the Plan. Any determination by the Committee pursuant to the Plan shall be final, binding and conclusive on all employees and participants and anyone claiming under or through any of them. Amounts paid or projected to be paid under the Plan are
referred to herein as &#147;Awards.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>SECTION 3. DEFINITIONS </U></B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.1</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;Award Period&#148; shall mean the period of time within which Performance is measured for the purpose of determining whether an Award has been earned.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.2</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;CEO&#148; shall mean the President and Chief Executive Officer of the Company. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.3</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;Covered Employee&#148; shall have the meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;162(m) of the Code. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.4</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;Group&#148; shall mean the Executive Office, Barnes Industrial, Barnes Distribution, or Barnes Aerospace, or any business unit, division, or similar collection of cost
centers, profit centers, or international subsidiaries that may be recognized as such by the Committee. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.5</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;Individual Target&#148; shall mean a percentage of salary for each individual participating in the Plan. The Committee will establish the Individual Target for each
participant no later than the earlier of (a)&nbsp;90 days after the start of the Award Period or (b)&nbsp;a date on which no more than one fourth of the Award Period has elapsed. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.6</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;Maximum&#148; shall mean a Performance level at or above which the amount paid or projected to be paid for an Award Period is equal to such maximum percentage of the
Individual Targets as may be established by the Committee for each participant no later than the earlier of (a)&nbsp;90 days after the start of the Award Period or (b)&nbsp;a date on which no more than one fourth of the Award Period has elapsed.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.7</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;Performance&#148; shall mean the performance objectives established by the Committee in advance, in writing, in terms of an objective formula or standard,
with respect to each Group for an Award Period, for the purpose of determining whether, and to what extent, an Award has been earned by the Group for such Award Period. The terms of the objective formula or standard shall preclude discretion to
increase the amount of the Award that would otherwise be due upon attainment of the Performance level. Performance objectives shall consist of targeted levels, targeted levels of return on, or targeted levels of growth for, one or more of the
following on a consolidated Company, consolidated Group, business unit or divisional level: earnings per share, net income, operating income, performance profit (operating income minus an allocated charge approximating the Company&#146;s cost of
capital, before or after tax), gross margin, revenue, working capital, total assets, net assets, stockholders&#146; equity, or cash flow. The foregoing criteria shall be determined in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, except
to the extent the Committee directs otherwise within the earlier of (a)&nbsp;90 days after the start of the Award Period or (b)&nbsp;a date on which no more than one fourth of the Award Period has elapsed, and may include or exclude any or all of
the following items, as the Committee may specify: extraordinary, unusual or non-recurring items; discontinued operations; effects of accounting changes; effects of currency fluctuations; effects of financing activities (by way of example, without
limitation, effect on earnings per share of issuing convertible debt securities); expenses for restructuring or productivity initiatives; non-operating items; effects of acquisitions and acquisition expenses; and effects of divestitures and
divestiture expenses. Any such performance criterion or combination of such criteria may apply to the participant&#146;s Award opportunity in its entirety or to any designated portion or portions of the Award opportunity, as the Committee may
</FONT>
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P>
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">specify. Unless the Committee determines otherwise at any time prior to payment of a participant&#146;s Award for an Award Period and subject to the
Committee&#146;s right to exercise negative discretion pursuant to Section&nbsp;6.1, extraordinary, unusual or non-recurring items, discontinued operations, effects of accounting changes, effects of currency fluctuations, effects of financing
activities, expenses for restructuring or productivity initiatives, non-operating items, effects of acquisitions and acquisition expenses, and effects of divestitures and divestiture expenses, any of which affect any Performance criterion applicable
to the Award (including but not limited to the criterion of earnings per share) shall be automatically excluded or included in determining the extent to which the Performance level has been achieved, whichever will produce the higher Award.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.8</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;Target&#148; shall mean a Performance level above the Threshold and below the Maximum at which the amount paid or projected to be paid for an Award Period is equal to 100% of
the Individual Targets for the members of the corresponding Group. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.9</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;Threshold&#148; shall mean a Performance level at or above which an Award is earned for an Award Period. For Threshold Performance, the amount paid or projected to be paid for
an Award Period is equal to such minimum percentage of the Individual Targets as may be established by the Committee no later than the earlier of (a)&nbsp;90 days after the start of the Award Period or (b)&nbsp;a date on which no more than one
fourth of the Award Period has elapsed. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>SECTION 4. GROUP PERFORMANCE LEVELS </U></B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If an Award Period is a calendar year, prior to March&nbsp;31, the Committee shall establish the Threshold, Target and Maximum for each Group, and the
method for computing the Award for each participant in the Group for such year if the Threshold, Target or Maximum is attained. If an Award Period is not a calendar year, then the Committee shall establish in writing no later than the earlier of
(a)&nbsp;90 days after the start of the Award Period or (b)&nbsp;a date on which no more than one fourth of the Award Period has elapsed, the Threshold, Target and Maximum for each Group and the method for computing the Award for each participant in
the Group for such Award Period if the Threshold, Target or Maximum is attained. The Committee may also designate one or more intermediate levels of Performance between the Threshold and the Target, and the Target and the Maximum, for a Group, and
the percentage of the corresponding Individual Targets that will be available for payment as an Award if Performance equals such intermediate level. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2"><B><U>SECTION 5. PARTICIPANTS </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If an Award Period is a calendar year, prior to March&nbsp;31, the Committee shall designate
the eligible participants and the respective Groups in which they shall participate. The CEO shall participate in the Executive Office Group for each Award Period. If an Award Period is not a calendar year, then the Committee shall designate the
</FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">eligible participants, and the respective Groups, no later than the earlier of (a)&nbsp;90 days after the start of the Award Period or (b)&nbsp;a date on
which no more than one fourth of the Award Period has elapsed. Except for (i)&nbsp;participants in the Plan during an Award Period who retire, die or become permanently disabled before Awards are paid for that Award Period pursuant to
Section&nbsp;8, whose Awards for that Award Period shall be prorated to the date of such retirement, death or permanent disability if it occurs before the last day of that Award Period, and (ii)&nbsp;participants in the Plan during an Award Period
whose employment is involuntarily terminated by the Company other than for cause (as determined by the Committee) on or after November&nbsp;1 of that Award Period (October 1 in the case of the 2008 Award Period) and before Awards are paid for that
Award Period pursuant to Section&nbsp;8, whose Awards for that Award Period shall be prorated to the date of such termination if such termination occurs before the last day of that Award Period, a person must be employed by the Company or one of its
subsidiaries on the date of payment of an Award in order to be eligible to receive an Award. For the avoidance of doubt, a participant&#146;s Award for any Award Period, including but not limited to an Award that is to be prorated pursuant to the
preceding sentence, (A)&nbsp;shall be determined in accordance with the objective formula or standard that was established by the Committee for the participant&#146;s Group for that Award Period in accordance with the Plan, based on the level of
Performance attained in that Award Period, and (B)&nbsp;shall be subject to any exercise of &#147;negative discretion&#148; by the Committee, within the meaning of Treasury Regulation Section&nbsp;1.162-27(e)(2)(iii)(A), and (C)&nbsp;shall be paid
at the time and subject to the conditions specified in Section&nbsp;8. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>SECTION 6. AWARDS </U></B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.1</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">After the end of the Award Period and based on the final Performance of each Group, the Committee shall determine the Award for each participant, based in all instances on the
participant&#146;s Individual Target and the Performance level achieved. No provision of the Plan shall preclude the Committee from exercising negative discretion with respect to any Award hereunder, within the meaning of Treasury Regulation
Section&nbsp;1.162-27(e)(2)(iii)(A). </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.2</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Subject to Section&nbsp;7, the Committee shall have the authority to refrain from making an Award to any participant. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>SECTION 7. LIMITATIONS </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Notwithstanding
anything in the Plan to the contrary, no Award in excess of the calculated Award shall be made to any Covered Employee under any circumstances. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">Awards at Target shall be greater than Awards at Threshold and less than Awards at Maximum. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Regulations under Section&nbsp;162(m)
of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, require that a maximum individual Award be established for any Awards to Covered Employees that are intended to qualify as performance-based compensation. For purposes of qualifying Awards as
performance-based compensation under such regulations, notwithstanding anything in the Plan to the contrary, no Award in excess of $7 million shall be paid to any Covered Employee for services rendered in any calendar year. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>SECTION 8. PAYMENT OF AWARDS </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Payment of any Award shall be contingent upon approval by the stockholders of the Company, prior to payment, of the material terms under which the Award is to be paid, in accordance with Section&nbsp;162(m)(4)(C)(ii)
of the Code and the related Treasury regulations. Unless and until such stockholder approval is obtained, no Award shall be paid. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Payment
of any Award shall also be contingent upon the Committee&#146;s certifying in writing that the Performance level and any other material terms applicable to such Award were in fact satisfied, in accordance with Section&nbsp;162(m)(4)(C)(iii) of the
Code and the related Treasury regulations. Unless the Committee so certifies, such Award shall not be paid. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%;padding-bottom:3px;line-height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Awards shall be paid within the 2<FONT SIZE="1"><SUP>&nbsp;1</SUP></FONT><FONT SIZE="2">/</FONT><FONT SIZE="1">2</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> months that immediately follow the expiration of the Award
Period (i.e., in the case of an Award Period that is a calendar year, on or after January&nbsp;1 and on or before March&nbsp;15 of the following calendar year). Awards shall be paid in cash unless otherwise decided by the Committee.
</FONT></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>SECTION 9. GENERAL </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">9.1</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The interpretation of the Plan by the Committee and its decisions on all questions arising under the Plan shall be conclusive and binding on all Plan participants.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">9.2</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Plan may be amended at any time, including retroactively, by the Committee. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">9.3</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Plan supersedes all prior incentive plans, including without limitation the Management Incentive Compensation Plan, for all participants, effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2001
for the Award Period of calendar year 2001 and Award Periods thereafter. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">9.4</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Any provision of the Plan to the contrary notwithstanding, (a)&nbsp;Awards to Covered Employees under the Plan are intended to qualify as performance-based compensation under Code
Section&nbsp;162(m)(4)(C), and (b)&nbsp;any provision of the Plan that would prevent an Award to any Covered Employee from so qualifying shall be administered, interpreted and construed to carry out such intention and any provision that cannot be so
administered, interpreted and construed shall, to that extent, be disregarded. No provision of the Plan, nor the selection of any eligible employee to participate in the Plan, shall constitute an employment agreement or affect the duration of any
participant&#146;s employment, which shall remain &#147;employment at will&#148; unless an employment agreement between the Company and the participant provides otherwise. Both the participant and the Company shall remain free to terminate
employment at any time to the same extent as if the Plan had not been adopted. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">9.5</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">All Awards are intended to qualify as short-term deferrals under Treasury Regulation section 1.409A-1(b)(4). The Plan shall be administered, interpreted and construed to carry out
that intention, and any provision of the Plan that cannot be so administered, interpreted and construed shall to that extent be disregarded. However, the Company does not represent, warrant or guarantee that any Award will qualify as a short-term
deferral, nor does the Company make any other representation, warranty or guaranty to any participant as to the tax consequences of any Award or of participation in the Plan. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Approved: 4/12/01 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Amended: 10/22/08 </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6 </FONT></P>
