<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">*</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">These amounts of EPS may be raised by the Committee not later than 90 days after the commencement of the Performance Year in question. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In no event may the Committee directly or indirectly, increase the number of Performance Share Awards that will be earned in the event the Minimum Performance Goal, the Maximum
Performance Goal or any particular level of EPS between the Minimum Performance Goal and the Maximum Performance Goal is attained in such Performance Year. The Committee reserves the right to exercise &#147;negative discretion&#148; within the
meaning of Treasury Regulation Section&nbsp;1.162-27(e)(2)(iii)(A) with respect to any Performance Share Award that would otherwise be deemed earned pursuant to the provisions of this Section&nbsp;2. Such negative discretion may be exercised at any
time prior to payment of the Award. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Any provision of Section&nbsp;2(a) or 2(b) to the contrary notwithstanding, Performance Share Awards that may be earned for any Performance Year pursuant to this Section&nbsp;2
shall not be deemed earned (i)&nbsp;until December&nbsp;31 of such Performance Year, and (ii)&nbsp;unless the Holder is employed by the Company on December&nbsp;31 of such Performance Year. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Issuance of Shares</U>. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A share of Common Stock shall be issued to the Holder (or, in the event of the death of the Holder, to the Beneficiary of the Holder) in payment of each Performance Share Award that
is deemed earned pursuant to Section&nbsp;2 above or Section&nbsp;4(b), Section&nbsp;4(c) or Section&nbsp;6 below (an &#147;<U>Earned Performance Share Award</U>&#148;). The share shall be issued at the time required by the applicable provisions
below of this Section&nbsp;3. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; padding-bottom:8px; margin-top:-2px" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"> <P STYLE="line-height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="line-height:95%; vertical-align:top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A share of Common Stock shall be issued in payment of each unpaid Earned Performance Share Award that pursuant to the
first sentence of Section&nbsp;2(a) above relates to either the 2008 or the 2009 Performance Year on the earliest of the following dates (i), (ii)&nbsp;and (iii)&nbsp;to occur where (i)&nbsp;is a date during the 43 day period beginning on the first
day of February and ending on the 15</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP>th</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> day of March immediately following the Performance Year to which such Earned Performance Share Award relates
pursuant to the first sentence of Section&nbsp;2(a) above (which date during that 43 day period shall be determined by the Company), (ii)&nbsp;is the date (if any) on which the Holder has a Separation from Service by the Company without
&#147;Cause&#148; (except by reason of the Holder&#146;s &#147;Death&#148; or &#147;Disability&#148;) or a Separation from Service by the Holder for &#147;Good Reason&#148; (within the meaning of Section&nbsp;4(c) below) during the Performance Year
to which the Earned Performance Share Award relates or an earlier Performance Year, and (iii)&nbsp;is the date (if any) on which a &#147;change in control event&#148; occurs with respect to the Holder (within the meaning of Treasury Regulation
section 1.409A-3(i)(5)(i)&nbsp;&amp; (ii)) on or after the date on which a Change of Control (as defined in Section&nbsp;6.4 of the Employment Agreement as amended and restated as of December&nbsp;31, 2008) occurs. For purposes of </FONT>
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P>
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">this Agreement, a &#147;<U>Separation from Service</U>&#148; means a &#147;separation from service with the employer&#148; within the meaning of Treasury
Regulation Section&nbsp;1.409A-1(h), where the &#147;employer&#148; means the Company and all corporations and trades or businesses with which the Company would be considered a single employer under Section&nbsp;414(b) or Section&nbsp;414(c) of the
Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (as determined in accordance with the first sentence of Treasury Regulation section 1.409A-1(h)(3)). </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; padding-bottom:8px; margin-top:-2px" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"> <P STYLE="line-height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="line-height:95%; vertical-align:top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A share of Common Stock shall be issued in payment of each unpaid Earned Performance Share Award that pursuant to the
first sentence of Section&nbsp;2(a) above relates to the 2010 Performance Year on the earliest of the following dates (i)&nbsp;and (ii)&nbsp;to occur where (i)&nbsp;is a date during the 43 day period beginning on the first day of February and ending
on the 15</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP>th</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> day of March 2011 (which date during that 43 day period shall be determined by the Company), and (ii)&nbsp;is the date (if any) on which
a &#147;change in control event&#148; occurs with respect to the Holder (within the meaning of Treasury Regulation section 1.409A-3(i)(5)(i)&nbsp;&amp; (ii)) on or after the date on which a Change of Control (as defined in Section&nbsp;6.4 of the
Employment Agreement as amended and restated as of December&nbsp;31, 2008) occurs. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Notwithstanding any provision of this Agreement to the contrary, (i)&nbsp;no &#147;distributions&#148; (within the meaning of Treasury Regulation section 1.409A-1(c)(3)(v)) of
deferred compensation that is subject to Section&nbsp;409A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 as amended (the &#147;<U>Code</U>&#148;) may be made pursuant to this Agreement to a &#147;specified employee&#148; (within the meaning of Treasury
Regulation section 1.409A-1(i))(&#147;<U>Specified Employee</U>&#148;) due to a Separation from Service before the date that is six months after the date of such Specified Employee&#146;s Separation from Service (or, if earlier than the end of the
six month period, the date of his or her death); and (ii)&nbsp;any distribution that, but for the preceding clause (i), would be made before the date that is six months after the date of the Specified Employee&#146;s Separation from Service shall be
paid on the first day of the seventh month following the date of his or her Separation from Service (or, if earlier, within 14 days after the date of his or her death). For the avoidance of doubt, the preceding sentence shall apply to any payment
(and only to any payment) pursuant to this Agreement to which Code Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(B)(i) (relating to Specified Employees) applies, and shall not apply to any payment that is not subject to Code Section&nbsp;409A as a result of Treasury
Regulation section 1.409A-1(b)(4) (relating to short-term deferrals), Treasury Regulation section 1.409A-1(b)(9) (relating to separation pay plans), or otherwise. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(e)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Holder&#146;s right to any series of payments pursuant to this Agreement shall be treated as a right to a series of separate payments within the meaning of Treasury Regulation
section 1.409A-2(b)(2)(iii), including without limitation for purposes of the short-term deferral rule set forth in Treasury Regulation section 1.409A-1(b)(4). </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(f)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In no event, except a 409A Change in Control Event as a result of which Performance Share Awards are deemed earned pursuant to Section&nbsp;4(b), Section&nbsp;4(c)(ii)(B) or
Section&nbsp;6 hereof, or if Performance Share Awards are deemed earned pursuant to Section&nbsp;4(c)(i), shall any shares be issued in payment of Performance Share Awards unless the Committee certifies in writing that the performance goals and any
other material terms (within the meaning of Treasury Regulation section 1.162-27(e)(5)) were in fact satisfied with respect to such Performance Share Awards. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(g)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The shares of Common Stock issued under this Agreement will be duly authorized, validly issued, fully paid and non-assessable. The shares to be issued shall be credited to a book
entry account with the Company&#146;s transfer agent in the name of the Holder (or, in the event of the death of the Holder, in the name of the Beneficiary of the Holder). At the election of the Holder (or, in the event of the death of the Holder,
at the election of the Beneficiary), stock certificates representing such shares will be delivered to the Holder (or the Beneficiary) as soon as practicable after the Company&#146;s receipt of the Holder&#146;s (or Beneficiary&#146;s) election;
provided that the shares are issued to the Holder (or, in the event of the death of the Holder, to the Beneficiary of the Holder), either by means of a book entry or stock certificate, when such shares are required to be issued by the applicable
provisions of Section&nbsp;3(b), Section&nbsp;3(c) or Section&nbsp;3(d) above. For the avoidance of doubt, shares will be issued on any date that applies under Section&nbsp;3(b), 3(c) or 3(d) above only in payment of Performance Share Awards that
are unpaid Earned Performance Share Awards on that date. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Termination</U>. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Except as provided otherwise in Section&nbsp;4(c), if the Holder&#146;s employment terminates before December&nbsp;31 of any Performance Year other than by reason of the
Holder&#146;s death, then the Award shall terminate with respect to all of the Performance Share Awards that have not been deemed earned as of the date of such termination, and the Holder will not be entitled to any payout of shares for such
unearned Performance Share Awards. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If (i)&nbsp;the Holder&#146;s death occurs during his employment by the Company and during the Award Period (and whether or not the Holder had a Separation from
Service before his death during employment), or (ii)&nbsp;the Holder&#146;s &#147;Disability&#148; within the meaning of Treasury Regulation section 1.409A-3(i)(4)(i) (&#147;<U>Disability</U>&#148;) occurs during his employment by the Company and
during the Award Period (and whether or not the Holder has a Separation of Service in connection with such Disability), then (A)&nbsp;on December&nbsp;31 of the Performance Year in which such death or Disability occurs the same number of Performance
Share Awards will be deemed earned for that Performance Year that would have been deemed earned pursuant to Section </FONT>
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P>
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2 if the Holder&#146;s employment by the Company had continued (and no death, Disability or Separation from Service occurred) through the end of such
Performance Year; provided that if a 409A Change in Control Event (as defined below in this Section&nbsp;4(b)) occurs after such death or Disability and during that Performance Year, then at the time of such 409A Change in Control Event the Holder
shall be deemed to earn the number of Performance Share Awards that relate to that Performance Year pursuant to the first sentence of Section&nbsp;2(a) above, whether or not the Minimum Performance Goal has been or is thereafter attained or exceeded
for that Performance Year; and (B)&nbsp;the Award shall terminate with respect to all Performance Share Awards that have not otherwise been deemed earned as of the date of such death or Disability, and the Holder will not be entitled to any payout
of shares for such unearned Performance Share Awards. For purposes of this Agreement, a &#147;<U>409A Change in Control Event</U>&#148; shall be deemed to occur if and when a &#147;change in control event&#148; occurs with respect to the Holder
(within the meaning of Treasury Regulation section 1.409A-3(i)(5)(i)&nbsp;&amp; (ii)) on or after the date on which a Change in Control (as defined in Section&nbsp;6.4 of the Employment Agreement as amended and restated as of December&nbsp;31, 2008)
occurs. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If the Holder has a Separation from Service by the Company without &#147;Cause&#148; (except by reason of the Holder&#146;s &#147;Death&#148; or &#147;Disability&#148;) or a
Separation from Service by the Holder for &#147;Good Reason&#148; and the &#147;Employment Term&#148; is terminated by the Company without &#147;Cause&#148; (except by reason of the Holder&#146;s &#147;Death&#148; or &#147;Disability&#148;) or by
the Holder for &#147;Good Reason&#148; (any of the foregoing Separations from Service being hereafter referred to as a &#147;<U>Covered Separation from Service</U>&#148;), then (i)&nbsp;any Performance Share Awards that pursuant to the first
sentence of Section&nbsp;2(a) relate to the Performance Year in which such Separation from Service occurs, except Performance Year 2010, or that relate to any Performance Year, other than Performance Year 2010, after the Performance Year in which
such Separation from Service occurs, shall be deemed earned as of the date of such Separation from Service, but only to the extent that such Performance Share Awards would have been deemed earned pursuant to Section&nbsp;2 had the Holder&#146;s
employment continued (and no Separation from Service occurred) through the expiration of the &#147;Severance Period&#148; as defined in Section&nbsp;6.2 of the Employment Agreement as amended and restated as of December&nbsp;31, 2008 and had the EPS
for the Performance Year in question equaled (but not exceeded) the EPS corresponding to the 100% performance factor in the table applicable to that Performance Year in Section&nbsp;2; and (ii)&nbsp;any Performance Share Awards that pursuant to the
first sentence of Section&nbsp;2(a) relate to Performance Year 2010 shall be deemed earned if, when and to the extent that such Performance Share Awards would have been deemed earned pursuant to Section&nbsp;2 had the Holder&#146;s employment
continued (and no Separation from Service occurred) through the expiration of the &#147;Severance Period&#148; as defined in Section&nbsp;6.2 of the Employment Agreement as amended and restated as of December&nbsp;31, 2008; provided that &#151;
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(A)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">for purposes of determining whether and the extent to which such Performance Share Awards would have been deemed earned pursuant to Section&nbsp;2 had the Holder&#146;s employment
continued (and no Separation from Service occurred) through the expiration of the &#147;Severance Period&#148;, (I)&nbsp;if the Covered Separation from Service occurs not later than ninety (90)&nbsp;days after the commencement of Performance Year
2010 (<I>i.e.</I>, on or before March&nbsp;31, 2010), any change in the EPS goals or performance factors for Performance Year 2010 pursuant to the penultimate sentence of Section&nbsp;2(a) shall be disregarded if and to the extent that the change
would cause the Holder to forfeit more of the Performance Share Awards that relate to Performance Year 2010 than the Holder would forfeit if the same EPS goals and performance factors were to apply to those Performance Share Awards as are timely
established in writing in accordance with Treasury Regulation section 1.162-27(e)(2)(i) and apply to performance share awards that relate to Performance Year 2010 and were granted on the Grant Date to senior officers who are actively employed when
such goals are established (&#147;<U>Active Officers&#146; 2010 PSAs</U>&#148;), and (II) any exercise of negative discretion by the Committee pursuant to this Agreement or the Plan shall be disregarded (aa) if and to the extent that such exercise
of negative discretion would cause fewer than 14,200 Performance Share Awards to be earned for Performance Year 2010, or (bb) if fewer than 14,200 Performance Share Awards are earned for that Performance Year absent such exercise of negative
discretion, or (cc) if such exercise of negative discretion would cause the Holder to forfeit a higher percentage of his Performance Share Awards that relate to Performance Year 2010 than the percentage of Active Officers&#146; 2010 PSAs that is
forfeited by senior officers who are actively employed when the negative discretion is exercised; and </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(B)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">if a 409A Change in Control Event occurs after such Separation from Service and before December&nbsp;31, 2010, and December&nbsp;31, 2010 falls within the &#147;Severance
Period&#148;, then at the time of such 409A Change in Control Event the Holder shall be deemed to earn 14,200 Performance Share Awards for Performance Year 2010, whether or not the Minimum Performance Goal has been or is thereafter attained or
exceeded for that Performance Year; and </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iii) the Award shall terminate with respect to all Performance Share Awards that
have not otherwise been deemed earned as of the date of such Separation from Service, and the Holder will not be entitled to any payout of shares for such unearned Performance Share Awards. Any capitalized </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">term that appears in quotation marks above in this Section&nbsp;4(c) , except the defined terms &#147;Active Officers&#146; 2010 PSAs&#148; and &#147;Covered
Separation from Service&#148; (which are defined herein), shall have the meaning ascribed thereto in the Employment Agreement as amended and restated as of December&nbsp;31, 2008. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Additional Condition</U>. If the Holder, at any time while the Award is outstanding: (i)&nbsp;directly or indirectly, whether as an owner, partner, shareholder, consultant,
agent, employee, investor or in any other capacity, accepts employment by, renders services for or otherwise assists any other business which competes with the business conducted by the Company or any of its Subsidiaries in which the Holder has
worked during the Holder&#146;s last two years with the Company or any of its Subsidiaries; (ii)&nbsp;directly or indirectly, hires or solicits or arranges for the hiring or solicitation of any employee of the Company or any of its Subsidiaries, or
encourages any such employee to leave such employment; (iii)&nbsp;uses, discloses, misappropriates or transfers confidential or proprietary information concerning the Company or any of its Subsidiaries (except as required by the Holder&#146;s work
responsibilities with the Company or any of its Subsidiaries); or (iv)&nbsp;is convicted of a crime against the Company or any of its Subsidiaries; or (v)&nbsp;engages in any activity in violation of the policies of the Company or any of its
Subsidiaries, including without limitation the Company&#146;s Code of Business Ethics and Conduct, or, at any time, engages in conduct adverse to the best interests of the Company or any of its Subsidiaries; then should any of the foregoing events
occur, the outstanding portion of the Award shall be canceled, unless the Committee, in its sole discretion, elects not to cancel it. The provisions of this Section&nbsp;5 are in addition to any other agreements related to non-competition,
non-solicitation and preservation of Company confidential and proprietary information entered into between the Holder and the Company, and nothing herein is intended to waive, modify, alter or amend the terms of any such other agreement.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Exception for 409A Change in Control Event</U>. Any provision of this Agreement other than Section&nbsp;4(b) to the contrary notwithstanding, but subject to Section&nbsp;7 of the
Employment Agreement as amended and restated as of December&nbsp;31, 2008, if the Holder remains in the continuous employ of the Company from the Grant Date to the date, if any, on which a 409A Change in Control Event occurs before the last day of
the Award Period, all of the Performance Share Awards that relate to the Performance Year in which the 409A Change in Control Event occurs and any Performance Year thereafter shall thereupon immediately be deemed earned and non-forfeitable, whether
or not the Minimum Performance Goal has been or is thereafter attained or exceeded for any Performance Year and whether or not the Holder is thereafter employed by the Company, and shares of Common Stock shall be issued in payment thereof at the
applicable time provided in Section&nbsp;3 above. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">9 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Adjustments Upon the Occurrence of Certain Events</U>. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the case of a stock dividend or a stock split with respect to the Common Stock, the number of shares subject to the Award shall be increased by the number of additional shares
the Holder would have received had he owned outright the shares subject to the Award on the record date for payment of the stock dividend or the stock split. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the case of any reorganization or recapitalization of the Company (by reclassification of its outstanding Common Stock or otherwise), or its consolidation or merger with or into
another corporation, or the sale, conveyance, lease or other transfer by the Company of all or substantially all of its property, pursuant to any of which events the then outstanding shares of the Company&#146;s Common Stock are combined, or are
changed into or become exchangeable for other shares of stock or property, the Holder shall be entitled to earn and receive pursuant to the Award, in lieu of the shares that he would otherwise be entitled to earn and receive pursuant to the Award
(the &#147;<U>Affected Shares</U>&#148;), and without having to make any payment to the Company or otherwise, the shares of stock or property which the Holder would have received upon such reorganization, recapitalization, consolidation, merger,
sale or other transfer, if immediately prior thereto he had owned the Affected Shares and had exchanged the Affected Shares in accordance with the terms of such reorganization, recapitalization, consolidation, merger, sale or other transfer.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In case of any distribution by the Company of rights or property to stockholders (including without limitation a spin-off), the issuance of stock options to persons other than
employees or directors of the Company, the issuance by the Company of securities convertible into the Company&#146;s Common Stock or into shares of any stock or security into which such Common Stock shall have been changed or for which it shall have
been exchanged, or any other change in the capital structure of the Company (other than as specified above in this Section&nbsp;7) which, in the judgment of the Committee, would effect a dilution or diminution of the Holder&#146;s rights hereunder,
the Committee shall make equitable adjustments in the number or kind of shares in respect of this Award, and such adjustments shall be effective and binding for all purposes of this Award. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Any provision of this Section&nbsp;7 to the contrary notwithstanding, only adjustments that qualify for the treatment described in Treasury Regulation section 1.162-27(e)(2)(iii)(C)
and that would not prevent the amounts payable hereunder from being &#147;objectively determinable&#148; within the meaning of Treasury Regulation section 1.409A-3(i)(1) may be made pursuant to this Section&nbsp;7. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>General Restriction</U>. If at any time the Board of Directors of the Company shall determine, in its discretion, that the listing, registration or qualification
of any shares subject to this Award upon any securities exchange or under any state or </FONT>
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">10 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P>
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Federal law, or the consent or approval of any government regulatory body, is necessary or desirable as a condition of, or in connection with, the granting
of this Award or the issue of shares hereunder, no rights under this Award may be exercised and no shares of Common Stock may be delivered pursuant to this Award, in whole or in part, unless such listing, registration, qualification, consent or
approval shall have been effected or obtained free of any conditions not acceptable to the Board of Directors. The Board of Directors shall use reasonable best efforts to effect or obtain such listing, registration, qualification, consent or
approval. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">9.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>No Assignment or Transferability</U>. This Award shall not be (i)&nbsp;assignable or subject to any encumbrance, pledge or charge of any nature, whether by operation of law or
otherwise, (ii)&nbsp;subject to execution, attachment or similar process, or (iii)&nbsp;transferable by the Holder except by will or by the laws of descent and distribution or to a Beneficiary as defined in Section&nbsp;2(d) of the Plan.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">10.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Withholding of Taxes</U>. The Committee may cause to be made, as a condition precedent to any delivery or transfer of stock hereunder, appropriate arrangements to satisfy any
Federal, state or local taxes required by law to be withheld with respect to such payment or transfer of stock and the Holder may be required to pay to the Company prior to delivery of such stock, the amount of any such taxes which the Company is
required to withhold, if any, with respect to such stock. The Company will accept shares of Company stock of equivalent Fair Market Value which would otherwise have been issued to the Holder hereunder, in payment of the Company&#146;s minimum
statutory withholding tax obligations if the Holder elects to make payment in such manner. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">11.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>No Implied Promises</U>. By accepting the Award and executing the PSA Agreement, the Holder recognizes and agrees that the Company and its Subsidiaries, and each of their
officers, directors, agents and employees, including but not limited to the Board of Directors of the Company and the Committee, in their oversight or conduct of the business and affairs of the Company and its Subsidiaries, may in good faith cause
the Company and/or a Subsidiary to act or omit to act in a manner that will, directly or indirectly, prevent all or part of the Performance Share Awards from being earned. No provision of this Agreement shall be interpreted or construed to impose
any liability upon the Company, any Subsidiary, or any officer, director, agent or employee of the Company or any Subsidiary, or the Board or the Committee, for any failure to earn Performance Share Awards that may result, directly or indirectly,
from any such action or omission, or shall be interpreted or construed to impose any obligation on the part of any such entity or person to refrain from any such action or omission. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">12.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Notices</U>. Any notice hereunder by the Holder shall be given to the Senior Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary in writing and such notice by the
Holder hereunder shall be deemed duly given or made only upon receipt by the Senior Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary at Barnes Group Inc., 123 Main </FONT>
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">11 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P>
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Street, P. O. Box 489, Bristol, Connecticut 06011-0489, or at such other address as the Company may designate by notice to the Holder. Any notice to the
Holder shall be in writing and shall be deemed duly given if delivered to the Holder in person or mailed or otherwise delivered to the Holder at such address as the Holder may have on file with the Company from time to time.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">13.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Interpretation and Disputes</U>. The Committee shall interpret and construe this Agreement and determine whether the Holder has satisfied the performance goals set forth in
Section&nbsp;2. Any such interpretation, construction or determination shall be final, binding and conclusive on the Company and the Holder. In the event there is any inconsistency between the provisions of this Agreement and the Plan, the
provisions of the Plan shall govern. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">With respect to any claim, demand, dispute, action or cause of action arising from such
interpretation or construction by the Committee that also arises under or relates to the Employment Agreement as in effect from time to time, the provisions of Section&nbsp;13 of the Employment Agreement as in effect from time to time (rather than
the following provisions of this Section&nbsp;11) shall apply. Any other claim, demand or controversy arising from such interpretation, construction or determination by the Committee shall be submitted first to a mediator in accordance with the
rules of the American Arbitration Association (&#147;<U>AAA</U>&#148;) by submitting a mediation request to the Administrator within thirty (30)&nbsp;days of the date of the Committee&#146;s interpretation or construction. The mediation process
shall conclude upon the earlier of: (i)&nbsp;the resolution of the dispute; (ii)&nbsp;a determination by either the mediator or one or more of the parties that all settlement possibilities have been exhausted and there is no possibility of
resolution; or (iii)&nbsp;thirty (30)&nbsp;days have passed since the filing of a request to mediate with the AAA. A party who has previously submitted a dispute to mediation, and which dispute has not been resolved, may submit such dispute to
binding arbitration pursuant to the rules of the AAA. Any arbitration proceeding for such dispute must be initiated within fourteen (14)&nbsp;days from the date that the mediation process has concluded. The prevailing party shall recover its costs
and reasonable attorney&#146;s fees incurred in such arbitration proceeding. The Holder and the Company specifically understand and agree that the failure of a party to timely initiate a proceeding hereunder shall bar the party from any relief or
other proceeding and any such dispute shall be deemed to have been finally and completely resolved. All mediation and arbitration proceedings shall be conducted in Bristol, Connecticut or such other location as the Company may determine and the
Holder agrees that no objection shall be made to such jurisdiction or venue, as a <I>forum non conveniens</I> or otherwise. The arbitrator&#146;s authority shall be limited to resolution of the legal disputes between the parties and the arbitrator
shall not have authority to modify or amend this Agreement or the Committee&#146;s interpretation or construction thereof, or abridge or enlarge rights available under applicable law. Any court with jurisdiction over the parties may enforce any
award made hereunder. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">12 </FONT></P>

<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">determines to be necessary, advisable or expedient to plan for, respond to, comply with or reflect Section&nbsp;409A of the Code, and (ii)&nbsp;consents in
advance to any and all such amendments of the PSA Agreement and any Prior Non-Grandfathered Compensation Arrangement, and (iii)&nbsp;consents in advance to any amendment of the Plan that the Board hereafter adopts on or before the 409A Documentary

the Holder is in Salary Grade 20 or above or meets the requirements of Code section 416(i)(1)(A)(ii) or (iii)&nbsp;(applied in accordance with the Treasury Regulations thereunder and disregarding Code section 416(i)(5)), the Holder shall be treated

Compensation Arrangement</U>&#148;) for the entire 12-month period beginning on the &#147;specified employee effective date&#148;, which shall be the January&nbsp;1 that immediately follows such specified employee identification date, unless the

1.409A-1(i) and the transition rules and official guidance under Code Section&nbsp;409A (a &#147;<U>Different Election</U>&#148;), in which case whether the Holder shall be treated as a Specified Employee shall be determined in accordance with any
such Different Identification Method so prescribed and any such Different Election so made by the Board or Committee. The Holder hereby irrevocably (i)&nbsp;consents to any such Different Identification Method that the Committee or Board may
hereafter prescribe and any such Different Election that the Committee or Board may hereafter make in accordance with that Treasury Regulation or otherwise in accordance with Code Section&nbsp;409A and the transition rules and official guidance
thereunder, for purposes of identifying the service providers who will be subject to the Six Month Delay with respect to payments under this Agreement, any Prior Non-Grandfathered Compensation Arrangement and any Future Compensation Arrangement, and

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">16 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<TR>

<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">consent to the Different Identification Method or Different Election in question if for any reason the Holder&#146;s consent to such Different Identification
Method or Different Election is not legally effective. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Company, with the consent of the Holder,
has amended and restated the PSA Agreement on the date in 2008 indicated in the first paragraph hereof, effective January&nbsp;1, 2009. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV ALIGN="right">

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.31
<SEQUENCE>26
<FILENAME>dex1031.htm
<DESCRIPTION>FORM OF AMENDED AND RESTATED CONTINGENT DIVIDEND EQUIVALENT RIGHTS AGREEMENT
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Form of Amended and Restated Contingent Dividend Equivalent Rights Agreement</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Exhibit 10.31 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Form of </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AMENDED AND RESTATED </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>CONTINGENT DIVIDEND EQUIVALENT RIGHTS AGREEMENT </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>For CEO </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">CONTINGENT DIVIDEND EQUIVALENT RIGHTS AGREEMENT executed in duplicate as of<B> February&nbsp;13, 2008 </B>(the &#147;<U>Grant Date</U>&#148;), between
Barnes Group Inc., a Delaware corporation (the &#147;<U>Company</U>&#148;), and Gregory F. Milzcik, an employee of the Company (the &#147;<U>Holder</U>&#148;)(the &#147;<U>CDER Agreement</U>&#148;), as amended and restated on December&nbsp;31, 2008,
effective January&nbsp;1, 2009 (the CDER Agreement as so amended and restated being hereafter referred to as &#147;<U>the Agreement</U>&#148; or &#147;<U>this Agreement</U>&#148;). </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The terms and conditions of the Agreement are set forth herein and shall apply on and after January&nbsp;1, 2009. For the avoidance of doubt, and any
provision of this Agreement to the contrary notwithstanding, if any provision of this Agreement (including in particular but without limitation any provision of Section&nbsp;2 below) would change the time or form of payment of any amount that is
payable under the CDER Agreement, such provision shall &#147;apply only to amounts that would not otherwise be payable in 2008&#148; within the meaning of paragraph .02 of &#167;3 of Notice 2006-79 as modified by Section&nbsp;3.01(B)(1) of Notice
2007-86, and shall be administered, interpreted and construed accordingly. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In accordance with the provisions of the Barnes Group Inc.
Stock and Incentive Award Plan as amended and in effect from time to time on and after the Grant Date (the &#147;<U>Plan</U>&#148;), the Compensation and Management Development Committee of the Company&#146;s Board of Directors (the
&#147;<U>Committee</U>&#148;) has authorized the execution of this Agreement and the payment of the cash compensation provided for therein. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants hereinafter set forth and for other good and valuable consideration, the parties hereto agree as follows: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Grant of Contingent Dividend Equivalent Rights</U>. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, the Company hereby grants the Holder contingent dividend equivalent
rights (the &#147;<U>Rights</U>&#148;). The Rights entitle the Holder to receive from the Company the cash payments described in Section&nbsp;2 below, if (and only if) Performance Share Awards are deemed earned during the Award Period pursuant to
Section&nbsp;2, Section&nbsp;4(b) or Section&nbsp;6 of that certain Performance Share Award Agreement between the Company and the Holder dated February&nbsp;13, 2008, as amended and restated on December&nbsp;31, 2008, effective January&nbsp;1, 2009
(the &#147;<U>PSA Agreement</U>&#148;). Capitalized terms that are not defined in this Agreement and that are defined in the PSA Agreement or the Plan shall have the meanings assigned to them in the PSA Agreement or, if no meaning is assigned to
them in the PSA Agreement, in the Plan. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Page 1 of 12 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; padding-bottom:8px; margin-top:-2px" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"> <P STYLE="line-height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2.</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="line-height:95%; vertical-align:top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Time and Amount of Contingent Dividend Equivalent Payments</U>. On a date during the 43 day period beginning on the
first day of February and ending on the 15</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP>th</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> day of March that immediately follows any date on which Performance Share Awards are deemed earned
during the Award Period under Section&nbsp;2 or Section&nbsp;4(b) of the PSA Agreement (which date during that 43 day period shall be determined by the Company), or, if Performance Share Awards are deemed earned during the Award Period at the time
of a 409A Change in Control Event pursuant to Section&nbsp;4(b) or Section&nbsp;6 of the PSA Agreement, on the date on which Performance Share Awards are deemed earned pursuant to Section&nbsp;4(b) or Section&nbsp;6 of the PSA Agreement, or if
Performance Share Awards are deemed earned on December&nbsp;31 of any Performance Year pursuant to Section&nbsp;2 or Section&nbsp;4(b) of the PSA Agreement and a 409A Change in Control Event occurs after such December&nbsp;31 and before Dividend
Equivalents are paid on such Performance Share Awards during the 43 day period described in the first clause of this sentence, then on the date of such 409A Change in Control Event, the Company will pay the Holder (or in the event of the death of
the Holder, the Holder&#146;s Beneficiary) an amount of money (&#147;<U>Dividend Equivalents</U>&#148;) equal to the Fair Market Value on the money payment date of the aggregate number of shares of Common Stock that would have been credited to the
Holder if, on each date on which a dividend other than a Common Stock dividend was paid to the holders of Common Stock the record date of which dividend fell during the period commencing on January&nbsp;1, 2008 and ending on the date on which shares
of Common Stock are issued to the Holder (or the Holder&#146;s Beneficiary) in accordance with Section&nbsp;3 of the PSA Agreement in payment of such earned Performance Share Awards (a &#147;<U>Dividend Payment Date</U>&#148;), the Company had
credited the Holder on its books with a number of shares of Common Stock determined in accordance with the following formula: </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">(A x B) /C </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%;padding-bottom:3px;line-height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">in which &#147;A&#148; equals the number of such earned
Performance Share Awards (in no event other than a 409A Change in Control Event to exceed forty-one and two-thirds percent (41<FONT SIZE="1"><SUP>&nbsp;2</SUP></FONT><FONT SIZE="2">/</FONT><FONT SIZE="1">3</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">%)</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP>*</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> of the number of Performance Share Awards stated in Section&nbsp;1 of the PSA Agreement (rounded, in the case of a fraction, to the
nearest whole Performance Share Award, as provided in Section&nbsp;2(a) of the PSA Agreement) and, in the event of a 409A Change in Control Event, not to exceed 100% of the number of Performance Share Awards stated in Section&nbsp;1 of the PSA
Agreement, unless in either case the excess is attributable solely to an adjustment pursuant to Section&nbsp;7 of the PSA Agreement) plus the aggregate number of shares of Common Stock credited to the Holder pursuant to this sentence before such
Dividend Payment Date as dividend equivalents on such earned Performance Share Awards, &#147;B&#148; equals the dividend per share paid on such Dividend Payment Date, and &#147;C&#148; equals the Fair Market Value per share of Common Stock on such
Dividend Payment Date. However, if the dividend is paid in property other than </FONT></FONT></P> <P STYLE="line-height:8px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000;width:10%">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; padding-bottom:8px; margin-top:-2px" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"> <P STYLE="line-height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP>*</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="line-height:95%; vertical-align:top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">125% of 33<FONT SIZE="1"><SUP>&nbsp;1</SUP></FONT><FONT SIZE="2">/</FONT><FONT SIZE="1">3</FONT><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">% </FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Page 2 of 12 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">cash, the number of shares of Common Stock credited to the Holder in respect of such dividend pursuant to the preceding sentence shall be determined in
accordance with the formula set forth above, except that &#147;B&#148; shall equal the fair market value on the Dividend Payment Date of the property which was paid per share of Common Stock as a dividend on such Dividend Payment Date. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%;padding-bottom:3px;line-height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If a dividend record date falls before the date on which shares of Common Stock are issued to
the Holder (or the Holder&#146;s Beneficiary) in accordance with Section&nbsp;3 of the PSA Agreement in payment of such earned Performance Share Awards, but the related Dividend Payment Date falls after the date on which the Dividend Equivalents on
such earned Performance Share Awards may be paid in accordance with the first sentence of this Section&nbsp;2, then, notwithstanding the first sentence of this Section&nbsp;2, the Dividend Equivalents on such earned Performance Share Awards shall to
the extent attributable to the dividend that is payable on such Dividend Payment Date be paid on such Dividend Payment Date, unless such Dividend Payment Date falls after the 15</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP>th</SUP></FONT><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> day of March of the calendar year following the Performance Year in which such Performance Share Awards were deemed earned under the PSA Agreement, in which case it shall be assumed for purposes of the first sentence
of this Section&nbsp;2 that such Dividend Payment Date falls on such 15</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP>th</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> day of March, so that the Dividend Equivalents on such earned Performance
Share Awards, including the portion thereof attributable to the dividend payable on such Dividend Payment Date, may (and shall) be paid in full on or before such 15</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP>th</SUP></FONT><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> day of March. For example, if Performance Share Awards are deemed earned during the Award Period at the time of a 409A Change in Control Event pursuant to Section&nbsp;4(b) or Section&nbsp;6 of the PSA Agreement, and
a dividend record date falls before such 409A Change in Control Event but the related Dividend Payment Date falls after such 409A Change in Control Event, the Dividend Equivalents on the Performance Share Awards that are deemed earned at the time of
such 409A Change in Control Event shall be paid at the time of such 409A Change in Control Event except to the extent of the Dividend Equivalent attributable to the dividend that is payable on the Dividend Payment Date that falls after the 409A
Change in Control Event, to which extent the Dividend Equivalent shall be paid on the Dividend Payment Date in question (assuming that it does not fall after the 15</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP>th</SUP></FONT><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> day of March of the year following the Performance Year in which the 409A Change in Control Event occurred). As another example, if (a)&nbsp;Performance Share Awards are deemed earned on December&nbsp;31, 2008
pursuant to Section&nbsp;2 of the PSA Agreement, (b)&nbsp;a dividend record date falls on March&nbsp;10, 2009, (c)&nbsp;shares of Common Stock are issued to the Holder in payment of such earned Performance Share Awards on March&nbsp;12, 2009, and
(d)&nbsp;the Dividend Payment Date for the March&nbsp;10 dividend record date falls on March&nbsp;21, 2009, the Dividend Equivalents on the Performance Share Awards that are deemed earned on December&nbsp;31, 2008 shall be paid in full by
March&nbsp;15, 2009, including any Dividend Equivalent attributable to the dividend payable on the March&nbsp;21, 2009 Dividend Payment Date, which for purposes of calculating the Dividend Equivalents that are payable by March&nbsp;15, 2009 shall be
assumed to fall on March&nbsp;15, 2009 rather than March&nbsp;21, 2009. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Page 3 of 12 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Any provision of this Agreement to the contrary notwithstanding, in no event (except a 409A Change in
Control Event as a result of which Performance Share Awards are deemed earned pursuant to Section&nbsp;4(b) or Section&nbsp;6 of the PSA Agreement) shall any payment be made pursuant to this Section&nbsp;2 unless the Committee certifies in writing
that the performance goals and any other material terms (within the meaning of Treasury Regulation section 1.162-27(e)(5)) applicable to such payment were in fact satisfied. For clarification purposes, (i)&nbsp;Dividend Equivalents paid pursuant to
this Agreement shall be non-forfeitable when paid, and (ii)&nbsp;the Holder will not be entitled to receive any Dividend Equivalents under this Agreement unless the Minimum Performance Goal set forth in Section&nbsp;2 of the PSA Agreement is
attained or exceeded for one or more of the Performance Years in the Award Period (as such terms are defined in Section&nbsp;2 of the PSA Agreement) or unless a 409A Change in Control Event (within the meaning of Section&nbsp;4(b) and Section&nbsp;6
of the PSA Agreement) occurs during the Award Period, and (iii)&nbsp;any provision of this Agreement to the contrary notwithstanding, in no event shall this Agreement entitle the Holder to receive shares of Common Stock or any property other than
money. An example that illustrates the intended operation of this Section&nbsp;2 appears in the Appendix. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Additional Condition</U>. If the Holder, at any time while Dividend Equivalents are payable hereunder: (i)&nbsp;directly or indirectly, whether as an owner, partner, shareholder,
consultant, agent, employee, investor or in any other capacity, accepts employment by, renders services for or otherwise assists any other business which competes with the business conducted by the Company or any of its Subsidiaries in which the
Holder has worked during the Holder&#146;s last two years with the Company or any of its Subsidiaries; (ii)&nbsp;directly or indirectly, hires or solicits or arranges for the hiring or solicitation of any employee of the Company or any of its
subsidiaries, or encourages any such employee to leave such employment; (iii)&nbsp;uses, discloses, misappropriates or transfers confidential or proprietary information concerning the Company or any of its subsidiaries (except as required by the
Holder&#146;s work responsibilities with the Company or any of its subsidiaries); or (iv)&nbsp;is convicted of a crime against the Company or any of its subsidiaries; or (v)&nbsp;engages in any activity in violation of the policies of the Company or
any of its subsidiaries, including without limitation the Company&#146;s Code of Business Ethics and Conduct, or, at any time, engages in conduct adverse to the best interests of the Company or any of its subsidiaries; then should any of the
foregoing events occur, the Rights shall be canceled, unless the Committee, in its sole discretion, elects not to cancel the Rights. The provisions of this Section&nbsp;3 are in addition to any other agreements related to non-competition,
non-solicitation and preservation of Company confidential and proprietary information entered into between the Holder and the Company, and nothing herein is intended to waive, modify, alter or amend the terms of any such other agreement.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>No Assignment or Transferability</U>. The Rights shall not be (i)&nbsp;assignable or subject to any encumbrance, pledge or charge of any nature, whether by
operation of law or </FONT>
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Page 4 of 12 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P>
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">otherwise, (ii)&nbsp;subject to execution, attachment or similar process, or (iii)&nbsp;transferable by the Holder except by will or by the laws of descent
and distribution or to a Beneficiary as defined in Section&nbsp;2 of the Plan. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Withholding of Taxes</U>. The Committee may cause to be made, as a condition precedent to any payment to be made hereunder, appropriate arrangements to satisfy any Federal, state
or local taxes required by law to be withheld with respect to such payment. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>No Implied Promises</U>. By accepting the Rights and executing the CDER Agreement, the Holder recognizes and agrees that the Company and its Subsidiaries, and each of their
officers, directors, agents and employees, including but not limited to the Board of Directors of the Company and the Committee, in their oversight or conduct of the business and affairs of the Company and its Subsidiaries, may in good faith cause
the Company and/or a Subsidiary to act or omit to act in a manner that will, directly or indirectly, prevent all or part of the Performance Share Awards from being earned. No provision of this Agreement shall be interpreted or construed to impose
any liability upon the Company, any Subsidiary, or any officer, director, agent or employee of the Company or any Subsidiary, or the Board or the Committee, for any failure to earn Performance Share Awards or Dividend Equivalents that may result,
directly or indirectly, from any such action or omission, or shall be interpreted or construed to impose any obligation on the part of any such entity or person to refrain from any such action or omission. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Notices</U>. Any notice hereunder by the Holder shall be given to the Senior Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary in writing and such notice by the Holder hereunder
shall be deemed duly given or made only upon receipt by the Senior Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary at Barnes Group Inc., 123 Main Street, P. O. Box 489, Bristol, Connecticut 06011-0489, or at such other address as the Company may
designate by notice to the Holder. Any notice to the Holder shall be in writing and shall be deemed duly given if delivered to the Holder in person or mailed or otherwise delivered to the Holder at such address as the Holder may have on file with
the Company from time to time. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Interpretation and Disputes</U>. The Committee shall interpret and construe this Agreement and make all determinations hereunder. Any such interpretation, construction or
determination shall be final, binding and conclusive on the Company and the Holder. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">With respect to any claim, demand,
dispute, action or cause of action arising from such interpretation or construction by the Committee that also arises under or relates to the Employment Agreement dated October&nbsp;19, 2006 between the Company and the Holder (the
&#147;<U>Employment Agreement</U>&#148;) as in effect from time to time, the provisions of Section&nbsp;13 of the Employment Agreement as in effect from time to time (rather than the following provisions of this Section&nbsp;11) shall apply. </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Page 5 of 12 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Any other claim, demand or controversy arising from such interpretation, construction or determination by the Committee shall be submitted first to a
mediator in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration Association (&#147;<U>AAA</U>&#148;) by submitting a mediation request to the Administrator within thirty (30)&nbsp;days of the date of the Committee&#146;s interpretation or
construction. The mediation process shall conclude upon the earlier of: (i)&nbsp;the resolution of the dispute; (ii)&nbsp;a determination by either the mediator or one or more of the parties that all settlement possibilities have been exhausted and
there is no possibility of resolution; or (iii)&nbsp;thirty (30)&nbsp;days have passed since the filing of a request to mediate with the AAA. A party who has previously submitted a dispute to mediation, and which dispute has not been resolved, may
submit such dispute to binding arbitration pursuant to the rules of the AAA. Any arbitration proceeding for such dispute must be initiated within fourteen (14)&nbsp;days from the date that the mediation process has concluded. The prevailing party
shall recover its costs and reasonable attorney&#146;s fees incurred in such arbitration proceeding. The Holder and the Company specifically understand and agree that the failure of a party to timely initiate a proceeding hereunder shall bar the
party from any relief or other proceeding and any such dispute shall be deemed to have been finally and completely resolved. All mediation and arbitration proceedings shall be conducted in Bristol, Connecticut or such other location as the Company
may determine and the Holder agrees that no objection shall be made to such jurisdiction or venue, as a <I>forum non conveniens</I> or otherwise. The arbitrator&#146;s authority shall be limited to resolution of the legal disputes between the
parties and the arbitrator shall not have authority to modify or amend this Agreement or the Committee&#146;s interpretation or construction thereof, or abridge or enlarge rights available under applicable law. Any court with jurisdiction over the
parties may enforce any award made hereunder. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">9.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>General</U>. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Nothing in this Agreement shall confer upon the Holder any right to continue in the employ or other service of the Company or any Subsidiary, or shall limit in any manner the right
of the Company, its stockholders or any Subsidiary to terminate the employment or other service of the Holder or adjust the compensation of the Holder. Nothing in this Agreement shall confer upon the Holder any right to receive shares of Common
Stock or any right as a shareholder of the Company. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This Agreement shall be binding upon the successors and assigns of the Company and upon the Beneficiary, estate, legal representatives, legatees and heirs of the Holder.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware, without regard to the principles of conflicts of laws thereof.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

compensation or fringe benefits to the Holder or any other employee of the Company or any of its subsidiaries which the Company or any of its subsidiaries now has or may hereafter put into effect, including without limitation any retirement,
pension, savings or thrift, insurance, death benefit, stock purchase, incentive compensation or bonus plan. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Any money that is payable pursuant to this Agreement (other than Dividend Equivalents paid on Performance Share Awards that are deemed earned at the time of a 409A Change in Control
Event pursuant to Section&nbsp;4(b) or Section&nbsp;6 of the PSA Agreement) is intended to qualify as &#147;performance-based compensation&#148; within the meaning of Section&nbsp;162(m)(4)(C) of the Code. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
